document.docAuthor: Baba, Tajamul Hassan & Usmani, Hd. Kamil
document.masterDocTitle: A revision and first record of the genus Oxyina Hollis, 1975 (Acrididae: Oxyinae) from India, with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision and first record of the genus Oxyina Hollis, 1975 (Acrididae: Oxyinae) from India, with description of a new species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Section of Entomology, Department of Zoology, Aligarh Muslim University, Aligarh 202002

Oxya Serville

Oxya bidentata Willemse
; Hollis, D. (1971) A preliminary revision of the genus
Oxya Audinet-Serville
( Orthoptera : Acridoidea). Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) Entomology , 26, 328–330.

Oxyina bidentata (Willemse)
; Hollis, D. (1975) A review of the subfamily Oxyinae ( Orthoptera : Acridoidea). Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) Entomology , 31 (6), 228.

Material examined.
INDIA
:
Kashmir : Anantnag :
Hugam , 33.8029°N , 75.1962°E , 1♂ , 2♀ ,
28.viii.2018
, Tajamul Hassan, Sweeping net
;
Pulwama :
Awantipora , 33.9222°N , 75.0155°E , 1♂ ,
7.ix.2020
, Mehdi Tahir, Hand-picked
;
Pulwama: Malangpora, 33.8928°N , 74.983°E , 1♂ , 08.ix.2019 , Tajamul Hassan, Sweeping net
;
Shopian: Balapora, 33.9212°N , 74.6538°E , 3♂ , 3♀ , 02-05.ix.2019 , Tajamul Hassan, Sweeping net.

Identification: Light green in colour, hind femur ochraceous green; ♀ are larger and sturdy than ♂ ; antennae filliform, 22 or 23 segmented, in ♀ antennae relatively smaller than head and pronotum lengths together; tegmen well developed and exceeding well beyond the tip of abdomen.

caption.paragraph:
PLATE 2. Genitalia of
Oxyina bidentata
♀. A. Ovipositor; B. Spermatheca; C. Dorsal view of supra-anal plate and cerci; D. Subgenital plate. Explanation of abbreviations: 1V = ventral valve of ovipositor, 2V = inner valve of ovipositor, 3V = dorsal valve of ovipositor, Apo = apodeme of ovipositor, Sd = subdiverticula of apical diverticulum, Ad = apical diverticulum, Prd = pre apical diverticulum, Sp = supra-anal plate, Cr = cercus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
♂ genitalia:
Supra-anal plate nearly deltoid in shape, basilateral folds absent; cerci laterally flattened but conical with bifid apex, upper lobe slightly shorter than lower lobe; subgenital plate long and narrow, apical half somewhat triangular with rounded apex; epiphallus expansive, right angular in lateral view, plate-like bridge, ancorae strongly developed and hook like with acute apex, lateral plates long and often slightly bent inwards from outer margins, anterior projections of lateral plates rounded, posterior projections ridge-like, lophi hook-like and narrowly spaced; basal valves of aedeagus broad and flattened, apical valves short and obtuse; apodemes of cingulum long with a slight posterior invagination.

♀ genitalia:
Subgenital plate long and broad with its surface completely flat, posterior margin trigonal bearing a long spine like process; cerci conical with subacute apex; supra-anal plate with wide apex; the dorsal and ventral valves of ovipositor bear sharp spines, posterior ventral basivalvular plate without spines; apical diverticulum of spermatheca long and coiled with two small subdiverticula giving it a trishula shape, apices bulged; preapical diverticulum inverted V shaped.
Geographical distribution: India : Kashmir, Afghanistan , Pakistan and Iran .
